Episode 020518

Calling all students! If you‚Äôre doing an essay about information technology and its role in the modern distopia, well come and have a load of this for free, because we are IT Stuff and that is our mission.

And the stuff crew with all the stuff are Kriss, Edafe and Shi.

Read on
Installed by shi on 2018-05-02
_blog_export.blog_bit:
Calling all students! If you‚Äôre doing an essay about information technology and its role in the modern distopia, well come and have a load of this for free, because we are IT Stuff and that is our mission.

And the stuff crew with all the stuff are Kriss, Edafe and Shi.
_blog_export.blog_more:
Our topics include: ‚ÄúDo you love reindeer?‚Äù "Tofu totebag!" TSB Bank down time Nintendo Switch hax Stack Overflow becomes self aware Facebook dating Weird billionaire club Farewell, Maplin

Photo credit - Southend News Network

Youtube of the Month: Simone Giertz - I built a Westworld robot and it's HORRIFIC

World of Stuff: Radiooooooooo - pick a station, pick a decade Conserve the Sound - an online museum for vanishing and endangered sounds

Singularity Watch The RAND corporation says AI could trigger a nuclear apocalypse by 2040 Bookies using AI to keep people gambling

Local Events Badonkadonk next week Weds 9th May upstairs in Turls Green Bradford Coder Dojo Saturday 19th May Feral Vector http://feral-vector.com/ 31st may

_blog_export.script: BCB IT Stuff recording 2 May 2018 transmission 3/4 May 2018 [0] Calling all students! If you‚Äôre doing an essay about information technology and its role in the modern distopia, well come and have a load of this for free, because we are IT Stuff and that is our mission. And the stuff crew with all the stuff are Kriss Edafe and Shi. Er, in other student news, looks like the brand new Office for Students website has gone live -- and all the text is boilerplate. Oopsie. Instead of Lorem Ipsum it‚Äôs weird stuff like ‚ÄúDo you love reindeer?‚Äù [2 Min] Right let‚Äôs get on. So what‚Äôs in the show today? well in the spirit of the local elections let‚Äôs do this democratically. So what we‚Äôre looking for is the perfect IT Stuff combo, we want Fail and Funny. So, let‚Äôs play Fail and Funny! TSB Bank down more than a week so far, Fail? Funny? Nintendo Switch Hacked! Stack Overflow! Drupal? The RAND corp says AI could trigger a nuclear apocalypse by 2040! Bookies using AI to keep people gambling! PC Recycler gets 15 months in prison for selling Windows restore disks! Billy Mitchell the Donkey Kong guy banned for cheating! Hackers stole a casino‚Äôs database through the fishtank in the lobby? ‚Äúhacked via a thermometer in an aquarium in the lobby. The attackers used that to get a foothold in the network They then found the high-roller database and then pulled that back across the network, out the thermostat, and up to the cloud." [ding!] Steam Spy shutting down Fail & Funny, let‚Äôs try the weird billionaire club. Jeff Bezos and the weird meetings at Amazon? Elon Musk boring for cyclists? What‚Äôs Zuck been up to? Zucky Cushion? Facebook Hate Speech button! Facebook Dating! [12 Min] If you thought Facebook was bad, how about the story of how the cops made an arrest in the case of the Golden State Killer after 30 years. They uploaded the DNA profile to a commercial geneology site which offers to match you up with people you might be related to... and bingo! a match with someone researching her family tree, so they looked at her family tree to find people of the right age in the right place, and went round this guy‚Äôs house, and snatched his dna from something like a fag end or a plastic cup in his rubbish, and now he‚Äôs been arrested for a dozen murders 45 rapes and 120 burglaries. Except this was the second attempt, it turns out they previously put some other innocent old guy through hell before clearing him. So do we think GEDmatch‚Äôs privacy policy is GDPR compliant? [14 Min] You're listening to IT Stuff here on BCB Radio, and if you haven‚Äôt turned off yet, congratulations on your high pain threshold. Or you might be deaf, that‚Äôs good too. Let‚Äôs get on! [15 Min] WORLD OF STUFF http://radiooooo.com/ [20 Min] YOUPOOP https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_u9jjcbgMpk [22 Min] Local Events badonkadonk next week Weds 9th May upstairs in Turls Green; and Coder Dojo Saturday 19th May (update yer website! https://bradford-coderdojo.github.io/) blog from the last session ;) Feral Vector http://feral-vector.com/ 31st may [25 Min] So at the end of the show let‚Äôs say farewell to this month‚Äôs defunct stuff, Maplin we‚Äôll miss you, and the Windows stuff that‚Äôs being killed off in the new Windows 10 release - homegroups, phone companion, help viewer and Groove Music :( Musicstuffs

Episode 040418

Hallo lifeforms welcome to IT Stuff, car crash radio about the car crash of technology. Living the future with us today are co-presenters Kriss, Shi and our very special guest, Edafe.

Read on
Installed by shi on 2018-04-04
_blog_export.blog_bit: Hallo lifeforms welcome to IT Stuff, car crash radio about the car crash of technology. Living the future with us today are co-presenters Kriss, Shi and our very special guest, Edafe.
_blog_export.blog_more:
Our topics include: Artificial intelligence Self driving cars Facebook not-quite-deleted videos Grindr data explosion Social Sentinel VICE vs RealSexyCyborg

Youtube of the Month: Revision Party Gun ban drives bloggers to Pornhub Shooting at HQ

Bitcoin Watch: Crypto Heater Quarnot QC-1 2900‚Ç¨ 650W

World of Stuff: End of the CHIP as we know it Apple New Chip Magic Leap headsets paranoia Oculus Rift outage

Local Events April 10 Bradlug 7pm @ bcbradio http://bradlug.co.uk/ April 11 Badonkadonk http://meetup.com/badonkadonk 7pm Spoons April 28 Coder Dojo https://bradford-coderdojo.github.io at 09:30 - 12:00 May 31-June 2 Feral Vector Hebden Bridge http://feral-vector.com/ tickets on sale now

_blog_export.script: BCB IT Stuff recording 4 April 2018 transmission 5/6 April 2018 [0] Hallo lifeforms welcome to IT Stuff, car crash radio about the car crash of technology. Yep we've literally got a car crash coming up, along with stuff about Facebook and bitcoin and Youtube, World of Stuff and local events. Living the future with us today copresenters Kriss, Shi and Edafe. [2 Min] So. Artificial intelligence. Self driving cars. What could possibly go wrong? Just a couple of weeks ago in Arizona in the States an experimental self-driving car hit and killed someone. Uber. 'Safety driver' looked inattentive. Another Tesla driver got killed too. Alexa crazy laughing, hookup with Lancashire police ‚Äúto broadcast crime updates, photos of wanted and missing people, and safety notifications to Amazon Echo owners‚Äù & soon to report crimes [6 Min] This month's other wreck is Facebook, we've been telling you for years they're bad and we don't do Facebook, maybe now you're listening. Call history, deleted videos. Musk deleted his. GDPR.[ZUCKS GREATEST HITS] It's not just Facebook, Grindr is in bother (what's Grindr) they have been sharing some very personal data, non-encrypted too, their justification was basically everybody else does the same [10 Min] Coming soon - Porn age verification It can fine you, it can block you ... but it can only suggest you protect data - Social Sentinel suicide terms, 'protest,' 'Black Lives Matter' or 'Muslim Lives Matter' [12 Min] [NEW JINGLE!] Bitcoin Quickie Crypto Heater Quarnot QC-1 2900‚Ç¨ 650W [14 Min] You're listening to IT Stuff here on BCB Radio, we're on 106.6fm, listen live on radioplayer, listen again all that why bother even mentioning it? the show's half finished, here's... [15 Min] WORLD OF STUFF End of CHIP Apple New Chip Magic Leap headsets on the way, demanding that developers keep test units in a locked safe Oculus Rift outage, cert expired, $15 store credit, who owns Oculus? Another day on the nets 1. @RealSexyCyborg asks @VICE not to report on her relationship status 2. @VICE does so anyway 3. @RealSexyCyborg asks to see article ahead of publishing 4. @VICE refuses 5. @RealSexyCyborg tells Twitter about this breach of contract 6. @VICE gets her Patreon shut down [19 Min] You Poop Revision Party Gun ban drives bloggers to Pornhub "We will not be seeking any monetisation from PornHub... we are merely looking for a safe harbour for our content and for our viewers," Shooting at HQ - dead person peeved about Youtube stopping payments - Radical Vegan [22 Min] Local Events April 10 Bradlug 7pm @ bcbradio http://bradlug.co.uk/ April 11 Badonkadonk http://meetup.com/badonkadonk 7pm Spoons April 28 Coder Dojo https://bradford-coderdojo.github.io at 09:30 - 12:00 May 31-June 2 Feral Vector Hebden Bridge http://feral-vector.com/ tickets on sale now Beware of scam Eventbrite, buzzwords + places + hundreds of dollars = spam eg. ‚ÄúLearn to Develop a Successful AI Startup Company Today‚Äù [25 Min] Musicstuffs Upcoming album from Spray, courtesy of their Youtube channel here's a taster medley from their rehearsal studio.

_blog_export._body:
Radio Venus Special

Hello, hello, hello out there. It is time for your favourite internet show about the internet ‚Äì IT STUFF, with yours sincerely, shi.

I‚Äôm missing my usual cohort of presenters ‚Äì it is, after all, International Women‚Äôs Day so you know, I need to work twice as hard to earn the same amount of recognition.

Read on
Installed by shi on 2018-03-07
_blog_export.blog_bit:
Hello, hello, hello out there. It is time for your favourite internet show about the internet ‚Äì IT STUFF, with yours sincerely, shi.

I‚Äôm missing my usual cohort of presenters ‚Äì it is, after all, International Women‚Äôs Day so you know, I need to work twice as hard to earn the same amount of recognition.
_blog_export.blog_more:
Our topics include: International Womens Day RSA conference kerfuffle with women speakers Gender Avenger OURSA alternate conference

Question Roulette: Questions from the audience include - Porn and censorship Fears in the tech world Digital literacy What is a virus The future of email

Youtube of the Month: Naomi ‚ÄòSexyCyborg‚Äô Wu Sheetal ‚ÄòTech Devi‚Äô Chintapatla

Singularity Watch Commercial AI can't recognise black women

Bitcoin Watch: J-pop girl band based on cryptocurrencies 50 Cent faked bitcoin wealth to look cool

World of Stuff: Tascam DR-44WL - 4-track handheld recorder with Wi-Fi functionality

Local Events Yorkshire Sound Women Network are inviting all women to a free special networks meetup in Leeds on Sunday, March 25th from 9am until 5pm. Bradford Coder Dojo is back on the 24th of March, 9:30am to noon at the Innovation Centre in Little Germany.

<title>{title}</title>
<meta name="theme-color" content="#2a3133">
<meta name="google-site-verification" content="wwHX7osRtV4Bkz8EpOeWaTCr4dYo8jgNqCFC-oCTCGs" />
<link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Patua+One" rel="stylesheet">
<link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Rubik:300,400,700" rel="stylesheet">
<link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="favicon16.png" sizes="16x16">  
<link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="favicon32.png" sizes="32x32">  
<link rel="icon" type="image/png" href="favicon96.png" sizes="96x96">  
<style>
{css}
</style>
_blog_export.script: BCB IT Stuff recording 7 March 2018 transmission 8/9 March 2018 [0] Hello, hello, hello out there. It is time for your favourite internet show about the internet ‚Äì IT STUFF, with yours sincerely, shi. [1min] I‚Äôm missing my usual cohort of presenters ‚Äì it is, after all, International Women‚Äôs Day so you know, I need to work twice as hard to earn the same amount of of recognition. Listeners ‚Äì we have a lot to cover in the next 30 minutes so I suggest you get a strong cup of delicious hot beverage, sit tight and try not to swear so much. I‚Äôll try to keep it tasteful. One more thing before we dig in ‚Äì throughout the broadcast, I‚Äôll be playing question roulette. For the past few weeks, BCB Radio has been holding womens radio workshops leading up to today‚Äôs broadcast. During the Radio Venus workshops, I‚Äôve been asked some questions about tech in general so I‚Äôll be playing them out randomly throughout the show. [2 min] Question roulette time! Q1 ‚Äì I‚Äôm afraid I have bad news ‚Äì there is no technical solution. This is fundamentally a people problem ‚Äì it‚Äôs like asking, ‚Äú My son is about to have conversations with people. How do I stop him from having bad conversations with people?‚Äù Obviously, one way is to stop him from having conversations with anyone ever, except when you‚Äôre present ‚Äì so that you can monitor and control the conversation to your liking. I mean, have you seen that Black Mirror episode? Teaching and talking to your kids might seem the obvious solution to this problem and I think it‚Äôs important not to single out communication using technology from any other form of communication. Just because it‚Äôs ‚Äòtech‚Äô does not mean there is a magic fix to the same problems you would have if it wasn‚Äôt ‚Äòtech‚Äô. Again, I will bring up the Black Mirror episode ‚Äì as humans, we are fixated on fixing things ‚Äì in this case, social problems with rules. Rules that we have been trying to apply to social situations for thousands of years. Technology is not magic, it‚Äôs still governed by the same rules, the same people and the same problems. So to summarise, there is no magical technical solution ‚Äì just talk to your kids. Group discussion here. [6 min] First up, we have the RSA kerfuffle. What‚Äôs this then? It says here - the RSA Conference is one of the world's largest cybersecurity gatherings. It takes place in San Francisco and around 45,000 people attend each year. So what‚Äôs new about this year? Apparently, women speakers. They don‚Äôt seem to exist ‚Äì nobody knows where they are or if they are even out there. Let‚Äôs face it, this isn‚Äôt the first conference to do this. It‚Äôs such an issue that we have websites like, ‚ÄòGender Avenger‚Äô - A community that ensures women are represented in the public dialog. On their website and social media presence, Gender Avenger calls out conferences and events that lack diversity in their panel of speakers. It‚Äôs a great cause but more importantly, it highlights how much this happens so often. [7 min] So back to RSA ‚Äì turns out a group of women and their allies have organized an alternate conference to run at the same time and in the same city. ‚ÄòOur Security Advocates Conference‚Äô or OURSA will be held about a mile from the original conference and there will be a live feed as well so everyone can take part. [8 min] Question roulette time! Q2 ‚Äì Let‚Äôs talk about robots ‚Äì or in this case, we all know it‚Äôs about AI or Artificial Intelligence. The way people are talking about ai right now is similar to the way computers were spoken about in the 1960s - ‚Äòfear of the unknown‚Äô and the ‚Äòpossibility that these new robot computer overlords‚Äô will know everything and be right all the time and take over the planet. Are these fears justified? Sure ‚Äì the same way any fear of the unknown is justified. The best way to deal with it, is to make it known, to understand what‚Äôs going on and to make sure you personally take as much control over the future as possible. For instance, social media ‚Äì I can‚Äôt stand the thing so I don‚Äôt use it. In the tech world, people are relatively unafraid of technology going too far. The biggest fear stems from politicians and corporations using technology for great evil and the rest of the world not understanding that it‚Äôs evil until it‚Äôs too late. I can safely say, that‚Äôs the general fear shared amongst all techies. [10 min] Youtube of the Month Naomi ‚ÄòSexyCyborg‚Äô Wu https://www.youtube.com/c/SexyCyborg ‚ÄúI'm a Maker and Web developer from Shenzhen, China. I like to show what life here is like here and sometimes post small projects that I'm working on.‚Äù Sheetal ‚ÄòTech Devi‚Äô Chintapatla ‚ÄúI'm an Engineering student and very much interested in Electronics and Tech. So, I'll be making videos on simple and useful electronic projects.‚Äù [13 min] Question roulette time! Q3 ‚Äì Digital literacy is as important as literacy. In fact, it‚Äôs impossible to be digitally literate without knowing how to read and write. It is the absolute minimum to function in modern society ‚Äì we have libraries and community centres that are encouraging people to come in and use their facilities. These very places are equipped with trained professionals to help the general public to learn. I see no reason why anyone should feel left out anymore than they would feel left out for being illiterate. If anything, I think these initiatives should be better marketed to the people who would greatly benefit from it. [15 min] Singularity Watch Thank you for tuning in to IT STUFF on International Womens Day! You are listening to BCB Radio 106.6FM New studies and research conclude that commercial artificial intelligence is great at picking out white men, but not quite so when it comes to black women. So what are the implications? Face it, we know big brother is remotely watching the great sea of faceless conspirators out there for our very own safety, right now, this very moment. What can make this process even better? Even more efficient? Algorithms, of course! Researchers argue that this software is ‚Äúvery likely‚Äù to be used for identifying criminal suspects. One error could result in dire consequences, people wrongfully accused of a crime or misidentified from security footage. So what now? Greater transparency. Companies are to provide information on the demographic and phenotypic images used to train AI models as well as reporting performance levels for each different subgroup. Besides, AI systems are only as effective as the data they‚Äôre trained on. Bad training data can lead to higher error rates and biased decision making, even when the underlying model is sound. [17 min] Question roulette time! Q4 ‚Äì A virus is malicious code designed by a human. We need to understand that a virus is not self aware - it has not manifested itself out of a computer. A virus is written by a person to do bad things on purpose. Bad things like deleting files ‚Äì deleting files is a normal thing to do but here, some thing is deleting your files without your consent. Now why do we call it a virus? Well, as well as doing bad things, it also tries to make copies of itself and send itself to other people‚Äôs computers. Sound familiar? Yes, like a virus you can catch that makes you sick, a computer virus has the ability to replicate itself and infect other people! [18 min] Bitcoin Watch A quick one this time on a couple of things that have something in common ‚Äì music. Pop music to be exact. Each member of the J-Pop girl band, 'Virtual Currency Girls' ‚Äì or Kasotsuka Shojo in Japanese ‚Äì is named after a different cryptocurrency. Wearing metallic wrestling-style masks and frilly maid outfits, they dance and sing about virtual markets with their debut single warning listeners to be aware of fraud and to maintain their security online. In other news, 50cent is bankrupt. A month ago, 50cent was reported to have $8million in bitcoin earnings he had forgotten about ‚Äì allegedly from album sales that were bought with bitcoins from fans. Turns out, 50cent has no clue what bitcoin even is and was only saying things to make him look cool. Groan. [19 min] Question roulette time! Q5 ‚Äì Emails are a fundamental bit of the internet that‚Äôs virtually impossible to get rid off. It‚Äôs very hard to sign up to social media type things without an email address so at the very least, you‚Äôll need one as your identity online even if you don‚Äôt use it. If it does get replaced, then you‚Äôll have exactly the same problems with the thing that replaces it ‚Äì too much spam, unsolicited messages etc ‚Äì I mean, I didn‚Äôt use to get cold calls and SMS spam on my mobile phone but now it‚Äôs the only thing I get. I‚Äôm looking at you, unnamed local clinic. I mean, thank you for updating me about vaccinations and flu jabs but a few texts a day about it will only make me block these helpful messages. [21 min] Shi‚Äôs World of Stuff Tascam DR-44WL [25 min] Local Events Before we end the show, a couple local tech events for the whole family. The Yorkshire Sound Women Network are inviting all women to a free special networks meetup in Leeds on Sunday, March 25th from 9am until 5pm. There will be special speakers and an opportunity to hear a summary of last year‚Äôs activities, followed by a round table discussion on sonic work. Bradford Coder Dojo is back on the 24th of March, 9:30am to noon at the Innovation Centre in Little Germany. If you‚Äôre a family interested in coding and technology but don‚Äôt know how, come join us. For both events, go to Eventbrite and search for Yorkshire Sound Women Network or Bradford Coder Dojo respectively. Thank you for joining me, I‚Äôll see you again next month with the usual band of suspects. I leave you now with Grimes. [25 min 52 sec] MUSIC GRIMES - REALiTi 4:24

_blog_export._body:
Episode 131217

Hello hello! So due to us all having made so much money from Bitcoin, we can't be bothered with Bradford any more and we're all moving somewhere more fitting to our new status as rich people.

_blog_export.music_name:
Do They Know It's Christmas by Richard Cheese

It's Beginning To Look A Lot Like Christmas by Shittyfluted
_blog_export.script: BCB IT Stuff recording 13 December 2017 transmission 14/15 December 2017 [0] Hello hello, So due to us all having made so much money from Bitcoin we can't be bothered with Bradford any more, we're all moving somewhere more fitting to our new status as rich people. [2 Min] No Sad Poop Emoji. [4 Min] So chrimbo came early for Apple. It was like an advent calendar, first day it turned out you could hack a mac - own it totally - with their new High Sierra upgrade. Get a prompt asking for username and password, type root, leave the password empty, Sure! You're in! A bit like ‚ÄúAre you a god‚Äù in Ghostbusters. They fixed that in 18 hours... and then next day, it turned out, if you'd received the fix first and then upgraded to High Sierra, the fix got wiped out. lol and then even if you reapplied the fix no longer worked. lololol. hows our Bitcoin doing? [8 Min] Social Media - may wants to make them pay! Facebook bans ‚Äúmen are scum‚Äù! ripping apart the social fabric of how society works! Twitter has no excuse for Trump! [11 Min] Here's one for absent friend Dick, US Homeland Security just let it slip they've hacked a 757 / In other transport lulz, researchers have warned the standard software ‚ÄúBAPLIE EDIFACT‚Äù for exchanging shipping manifests is so insecure they might be able to sink boats by making them load all the heavy stuff on one side. Or put flammable material where it's unsafe. Or sabotage coffee by putting it next to smelly fish. Or just nick a few containers. [14 Min] You are listening to IT Stuff on BCB Radio 106.6 FM. Time for a very small World of Stuff? IBM new typeface, IBM Plex; http://app.programmingfonts.org [16 Min] Time for Youtube of the month! [YOUPOOP] Make Anything 3D Printing channel, Experimenting with 3D Printed Fabric [3DFABRIC.WAV] Devin Montes https://www.myminifactory.com/users/MakeAnything Other Youtube news, dispute in Finland over music rights made Youtube in Finland block all music by Finnish composers, let's zoom and enhance, can you name any Finnish composers? and can you name Sibelius' greatest hit? That's right.... banned in Finland. lol. Agreement reached in a day. And this. Interviewer:¬†What would you say to those who argue cementing your head in a microwave was a stupid stunt that wasted firefighters' time that could have been spent helping someone else? Moron:¬†What about those who drink and drive or get drunk and start fights? They waste police time. Singularity Update, Google Brain made its AI make an AI, and the AI that the AI made turns out to be better than humans at recognising objects in real time video. (-> Tom Watson) [22 Min] So do we have any events? How's bitcoin doing? Is Bitcoin a scam? [25 Min] ‚ÄúAttention: Attention: We are drunk today, so updates will be tomorrow! This is the last day when you can buy a lifetime DeUHD! Catch the moment!‚Äù [25 min 52 sec] DECMUSIC.WAV 4 min exactly [29 min 52 sec]Musicstuffs: Do They Know It's Christmas by Richard Cheese https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4ehSjOPsjvc It's Beginning To Look A Lot Like Christmas by Shittyfluted https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=P94GWpPS_oQ

blog_bit: Wahey! It's that time again, you know, the good stuffs time with yer ol' band of geeks, spilling out the deeds on this month's information technology scene.
blog_more:
Our topics include: Popcorn-time ransom-ware Twitter CEO get banned from twitter Boeing Dream-liner Snoopers charter & Uber Tweet of the month

World of Stuff: reMarkable - The paper tablet for people who prefer paper. Here to replace your notebooks, sketchbooks and printouts. Paper-like reading, writing and sketching with digital powers.

Youtube of the month: https://www.youtube.com/user/bigclivedotcom
